desc: This transformation will add some meaningless sentence to premise, which do not change the semantics.

ori.premise: An old man with a package poses in front of an advertisement.
ori.hypothesis: A man walks by an ad.
ori.label: contradiction

trans.premise: An old man with a package poses in front of an advertisement.
trans.hypothesis: A man walks by an ad. And we have to say that the sun is not moon, the moon is not sun.
trans.label: contradiction

ori.premise: A young family enjoys feeling ocean waves lap at their feet.
ori.hypothesis: A family is at the beach.
ori.label: entailment

trans.premise: A young family enjoys feeling ocean waves lap at their feet.
trans.hypothesis: A family is at the beach. And we have to say that the sun is not moon, the moon is not sun.
trans.label: entailment
